characters: MONSTERS OF THE DEEP FUN TUNNEL
MOVE FROM THEM THROUGH THE WINDOW
MIKE AND KATHRYN AND THE MEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crystal green.  Beautiful fish of all colors and faces swarm happily by.  A spectacular undersea garden blooms like plants touched by springtime.  A quick- silver surface of color mirrors lush reef growth.

dialogues.speaker: SURREALISTIC CREATURES
dialogues.text: Swim, creep, crawl, stalk, hide in their endless quest to survive.

dialogues.speaker: FISH
dialogues.text: A beautiful aquarium of peace and tranquility.

dialogues.speaker: TERROR
dialogues.text: The fish suddenly explode in panic, darting in all different directions, swimming instinctively for their threatened lives.

dialogues.speaker: GROUPER
dialogues.text: 300 pounds.  Awesome and ugly, swimming away as fast as it can go.

dialogues.speaker: GROUPER
dialogues.text: As we come closer on it. Closer. It glances back, eyes wide with fear of impending death. It reverses course, ATTACKING CAMERA, and the grouper gets

dialogues.speaker: TORN IN HALF
dialogues.text: Shredded by some unseen monster.  There's a violent THRASHING SOUND and clouding of the ocean, then quiet again as chunks of tissue float in the bloody brine.

dialogues.speaker: GROUPER'S HEAD
dialogues.text: Drifts along, torn from its body.  Bug eyes open wide in death.

dialogues.speaker: CAMERA
dialogues.text: Swoops around, moving quickly again.  On the surface, high above, something attracts its attention.  It goes to investigate.

dialogues.speaker: WATER SKIERS
dialogues.text: Speeding over the surface.

dialogues.speaker: CAMERA
dialogues.text: Let's now refer to it as SHARK, even though we do not see it.  It starts after the skiers.

dialogues.speaker: WATER SKIERS
dialogues.text: Tanned, healthy, all-American boys and girls.  They come SHOOTING across the water in formation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Follows after them, curious as to what's going on.

dialogues.speaker: SKIERS
dialogues.text: Start forming a PYRAMID, climbing up onto each other. One of the girls is KELLY.  She's blonde and adorable and is climbing onto TOD's broad shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The space shuttle has landed!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold still, damn it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you doing later?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taking my boyfriend to the airport.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought I was your boyfriend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Following along, piqued.

dialogues.speaker: SKIERS
dialogues.text: The pyramid is formed.  The COACH in one of the speed- boats speaks through his bullhorn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking good, kids.  Real good. That's the way.  Keep it nice and tight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep it nice and tight, Kelly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (giggling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't talk that way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember, skiers stay up longer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up, Tod!  Be serious!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am serious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As it follows the skiers' wake...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slick corporate vice president.  Sea Kingdom is his baby.  He points to a large SCALE MODEL of the park as he talks to the crowd of press people and V.I.P.'s.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two years in the making, at a cost of seven million dollars, our new Under the Sea Kingdom is an exploration of earth's inner space, capturing the excitement and adventure of man beneath the sea.  No other amusement park offer exhibits like... (points)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Monsters of the Deep fun tunnel, with giant squids, manta rays, and moray eels. (points)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've added to the fantasy of lost underwater treasure ships for kiddies, sunk in... (points)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... a reproduction of incredible coral reefs and caves where we've imported thousands of rare beautiful tropical fish... (points)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And in this enclosed exhibit is Shark Encounter, where moving walkways take you safely through shark-infested waters. A pretty woman REPORTER has a question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of sharks, Mister Calvin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doctor Allen is our Marine Biologist and Mammalogist, formerly in charge of the state's Conservation Marine Laboratory. I think she can answer better than I. They all turn to

dialogues.speaker: KATHRYN
dialogues.text: Dark hair, mid-twenties.  The brain matches the beauty. She is far more comfortable in the company of her dolphins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Domesticated sharks, mostly. Mako.  Tiger.  Nurse.  Sand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't they attack each other?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Contrary to popular belief, when sharks are well fed, they will not hunt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we keep them well fed, so be kind what you say about us, or... They all chuckle.  Except Kathryn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have a Great White.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... And I really do have to get back to my own mammals, so, if you'll excuse me, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, of course.  Thank you for stopping by, Doctor. Kathryn gets out of there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It seems what you've created here is a combination Art Nouveau and Jules Verne.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly.

dialogues.speaker: WATER SKIERS
dialogues.text: Up in their pyramid formation.  The Coach gives them praise through his bullhorn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great, gang.  Beautiful!  Making me proud of you.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Fighting for her balance, her legs are wobbly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch it, I'm gonna fall.  I'm gonna go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Balance, Kelly.  Bal-lance!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Kelly.  Not now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lean back!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahhhhh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You fall, I'll kill you.  I swear I'll drown you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, God.  I can't... The Coach doesn't know what's going on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now tomorrow, there's gonna be this great big banner that we break through here -- so now isn't the time to fall, Kelly. That's all Kelly needed to hear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahh... ahhh... ohhhh...

dialogues.speaker: TIMBER
dialogues.text: Kelly falls, sending the entire pyramid pitching into the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw... shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up ahead, shadows thrashing through the water.  The shark rises to see what's going on.

dialogues.speaker: SKIERS IN WATER
dialogues.text: Start reassembling as the speedboat idles, Evinrude RUMBLING.  The Coach barks at them through the bullhorn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell was that all about? Kelly! The skiers grab hold of their lines, looking at Kelly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (guiltily)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... She did it again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Concentrate out there!  We can't have mistakes tomorrow! They're about ready to go again.  The boat starts to pull away.

dialogues.speaker: SKIERS
dialogues.text: In their starting positions.  They come RISING out of the water as

dialogues.speaker: SHARK
dialogues.text: Comes trailing in their wake, just seconds behind.  We see the tip of a giant triangular FIN cutting through the water, following them.  The fin is like a monstrous gray sail.  Up ahead, we see a giant set of

dialogues.speaker: GATES
dialogues.text: Start closing, coming down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It swims under the closing, heavy wire mesh gates. Gonna be a tight squeeze.

dialogues.speaker: WHAM-THUMP
dialogues.text: There's a shuddering vibration as the gate hits on something BIG.  The shark swims away as the gate CLANGS.

dialogues.speaker: DAISY AND BOBBY DOLPHIN
dialogues.text: Going through their "paces."  Kathryn is in the water with them.  She blows a whistle and uses hand signals, giving affectionate rewards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to dolphins)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, Daisy?  What do you want? Tell me. The dolphin "talks" back to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to other dolphin)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come here, Bobby.  Come on, give me a kiss. The dolphin gives her (and audience) a big wet kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Want another one? She turns to him and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure do. (to dolphin)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kiss me again, Bobby.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE AND KATHRYN
dialogues.text: Laughing.  Take each other in their arms.  A soft, tender kiss, which the dolphins and penguin appreciate. MICHAEL BRODY is late twenties.  Tan and fit.  Head engineer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, not much longer to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it, 97 days?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Till this opens, not our wedding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hope I make it through both.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (kissing him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will.  I'll see to it. Mike points to the nervous, chittering dolphins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, Kathryn.  They're jealous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're acting very strange suddenly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pre-opening jitters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess. Mike's BEEPER goes off.  He sighs and speaks into it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brody here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike, we're having a problem with the gate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Mission Control underwater.  All the inner workings of Sea Kingdom are monitored down here.  The two OPERATORS watch the dials and gauges and 20 TV screens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of trouble?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not closing, Mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's impossible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.  But we show it's not closing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, okay... We'll get someone on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn it.  I can't understand! (to her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta go, hon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't forget you have your brother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See you later. They kiss and Mike turns at a RUMBLING SOUND.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Comes lumbering towards the water's edge.  Seated high on the boom with a camera is

dialogues.speaker: PHILIP HUTTON
dialogues.text: A very refined, well-educated, aristocratic Englishman, 30.  IKE directs the crane and SHELLY drives.  If you didn't know better, you might suspect there's something between the three of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bring the crane over.  Come down. Easy down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. Mike comes over to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hutton, how the hell did you get my crane?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calvin said it was all right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well I didn't!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, we're not going to hurt it, old boy. (to Kathryn)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I say, love, is Flipper ready to go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the telly.  We're to film him for the evening news.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody told me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just did.  Can you make them do tricks?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're not tricks.  They're behavior patterns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine.  Have them do some.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.  They're nervous and skittish right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, aren't we all. Kathryn turns in disgust, looking at Michael.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That macho pompous English --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't let him get you.  Just continue your patterns and pretend he's not around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My imagination isn't that good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, I gotta go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, bye. Another soft kiss. As Mike passes Philip, he slaps the crane and calls up to Philip who's readying his camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make sure you put this back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aww, can't I keep it? Mike stares at him.  Takes an angry beat.  Philip still looking into the lens.  Mike leaves. Philip calls to Kathryn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay now.  Have Flipper flip or something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make this quick! She turns to her dolphins.

dialogues.speaker: WATER SKIERS
dialogues.text: They're up in the pyramid once again, riding smooth. All but Kelly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahhh, ahhh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gotta sneeze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you dare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't help it... ahh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Kelly!  We're almost in!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahhhh...

dialogues.speaker: SHARK POV
dialogues.text: Staying right below the skiers.  It starts to rise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The media munch on hors d'oeuvres and champagne. From their vantage point, Calvin points out the skiers for them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In addition to the aerobatics that our skiers are performing, they'll be doing the comedy ski show "The Hatfields and McCoys," choreographed by world-famous skier Janet Turner.

dialogues.speaker: SKIERS
dialogues.text: Coming onto shore now.  The Coach speaks to them through the horn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beautiful.  Hold it, hold it... Kelly's hanging on, eyes tearing, mouth ready to explode in a sneeze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get ready.  Here we go now... Make me proud of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Release. They let go of their ropes and come out of the pyramid, gliding in to shore as Kelly lets out a huge SNEEZE and stumbles onto shore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God bless you.

dialogues.speaker: SHARK
dialogues.text: Swoops in close, then turns and heads back out.  No fun here.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE IN ZODIAC BOAT
dialogues.text: Comes speeding up to a WORKBOAT deck.  Mike does a hot dog 180-degree spin through the water and eases up to the workboat where SINGER holds a crackling walkie- talkie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.  It's off the track.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me the walkie. Singer does.  Mike talks into it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Overman!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We get time and a half for this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Overman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then we'll be done in a minute. Singer leans into the walkie-talkie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go, guys.  I got a date tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She have a friend?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but you don't.  Get to work.

dialogues.speaker: DIVERS
dialogues.text: OVERMAN and HARRIS.  They are arc-welding on the GATE. The sparks flash brilliantly through the water.  They replace a pin, HAMMERING it in place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay on top of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: KATHRYN POPPING OUT OF WATER
dialogues.text: She calls to Philip, who holds his camera but isn't filming the background.  The dolphins dart about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's no use.  They won't come into the lagoon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well then, can you have them jump to the camera over here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute.  These aren't kangaroos, Mr. Hutton.  They're dolphins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought they were clever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can have them walk backwards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no.  That won't do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you, something's upset them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I have to get this into the networks.  If you can't do it, you can't do it, that's all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, we'll just try again, dear. Keep working on it.  Maybe you'll get it one of these years. (to his men)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pack up, boys.  Flipper's a flop.

dialogues.speaker: KATHRYN
dialogues.text: Watches with scorn as the start the crane up and leave.  Kathryn goes into the water, a look of determination.

dialogues.speaker: KATHRYN IN WATER
dialogues.text: Stands to her knees, BLOWING a whistle and SLAPPING the water hard. 45        BOBBY and DAISY Look at her and respond in a cute but frustrating way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!  That is wrong!  What is the matter with you? Again, she blows the whistle and slaps the water three times as

dialogues.speaker: MIKE PULLS UP
dialogues.text: In his Zodiac.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You called, Doctor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything's going wrong.  I'm having more trouble with Bobby than I ever have before.  I can't get him to respond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How come?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.  I can't understand it.  Something's bothering them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what else is bothering you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Hutton.  He really pisses me off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, you really don't like him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't like what he does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's his work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doesn't need the money.  He inherited a fortune.  He kills for kicks.  TV battles between non-predator fish and divers. The diver always wins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, forget him now.  I'm going to pick up Sean.  Take a ride?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't leave now.  We taking Sean out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.  Want to try that new Italian place?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you don't need all that starch.  You're getting too fat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not enough loving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out of here! She playfully splashes water at him.  He yells and heads to shore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll have sushi. She smiles and shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: WORKBOAT DECK
dialogues.text: As Overman and Harris pull themselves out of the water. They hand Singer the equipment and start getting out of their tanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Miller time!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You buying?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Singer)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coming with us?  Overman's buying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'll take the money instead. Overman looks around the deck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see the three-quarter socket?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  Down there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Way to go, guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You two go ahead.  I'll meet you at Captain Kidd's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Singer and Harris put the equipment into the boat as Overman puts his mask back on.

dialogues.speaker: OVERMAN
dialogues.text: Dives back into the water.

dialogues.speaker: OVERMAN
dialogues.text: The diver enjoys this freedom; not encumbered with weights and tanks, he swipes at passing fish as he descends into the deep.  But suddenly, all the fish that were curiously inspecting him turn and scatter.

dialogues.speaker: OVERMAN
dialogues.text: Looks about, apprehensive eyes peering through his mask.  He looks again and continues diving.

dialogues.speaker: OVERMAN
dialogues.text: As we come MOVING IN on him from behind.  Overman turns.  His face freezes in a horrifying SCREAM of terror.

dialogues.speaker: OVERMAN
dialogues.text: As a MONSTROUS unseen force plows into him, and there is a vicious thrashing and explosion of water.

dialogues.speaker: 727 ON APPROACH
dialogues.text: It comes in like a giant bird, flaps down out, gear down.  It lands in our laps and continues past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arriving passenger SEAN BRODY moves with the others. Sean is a junior in college.  Athletic, good looking, he looks around and sees his brother rushing up to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sean!

dialogues.speaker: MIKE AND SEAN
dialogues.text: A warm, macho, brotherly hugging and punching exchange.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, what's goin' on, little brother!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn!  You sonuvabitch!  Look at you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look great, don't I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got a job for me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, we'll find something for you.  Shoveling shark shit or something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (apprehensive)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sharks???

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reassuringly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a restaurant.  You sit there and they swim around you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I'll go to McDonalds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you do in school?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great.  I got one B, two C's, and eight incompletes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I'm proud of you, kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So was Dad. He shows Mike a

dialogues.speaker: POLAROID PHOTOGRAPH OF SHERIFF BRODY
dialogues.text: Grimacing as usual, his hair G.I. crewcut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Took it this morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He needs a haircut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How is he?  Still fighting crime?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last week he broke up a major counterfeiting ring.  Gang of kids were using slugs in the Pac-Man games.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big bust!  He confiscate their water pistols?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Booked them all at Baskin- Robbins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (appreciating)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's Dad... Mike throws an arm around Sean and hugs him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He taught us good, though, didn't he, Sean?  We were lucky to grow up the way we did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's grown up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gee, it's good to see you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to see Kathryn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just find your own.  Like Dad says, there's plenty of fish in the sea. They laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moving through the terminal, licking an ice cream cone, she sees Mike and Sean and comes running over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike! Mike and Sean stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me a ride?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Preciate it. Mike's BEEPER gives off a faint signal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (harassed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do they want now...? He looks around for a phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly, this is my brother Sean. Don't let him get lost. Mike heads for the phones in the b.g. as Sean and Kelly study each other, liking what they see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, you just get here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, from Boston.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was seeing this guy off.  He flew in from Dallas.  Wants to marry me.  He's okay, but Texans are so possessive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Massachussettans aren't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Course they're also so rich.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Massachussettans aren't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long you staying?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, it depends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You like Florida? Sean looks at her, in her shorts and tank top.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I haven't seen that much, but so far it looks great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suggestively)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, wait till you see the rest. They smile at each other.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE ON PHONE
dialogues.text: Whatever he's hearing isn't good.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN AND KELLY
dialogues.text: The romance continues to build.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gonna work at The Kingdom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Depends on big brother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a water-skier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's too bad.  I don't like water.  I don't like being around in.  I never go in it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How come?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goes back to when I was a kid. Mike's okay, he's gotten over his fears, but I haven't.  I can't even drink it. Mike comes over in a hurry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know Overman?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Musclehead?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's missing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hope with none of my girl friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike and Sean and Kelly walk to the parking lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly, could you look after Sean for a while?  Show him around for me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.  No problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, thanks. The brothers wink at each other.

dialogues.speaker: KATHRYN RIDING WHALE
dialogues.text: She takes it through a series of moves, not noticing Mike and Sean and Kelly pull up in the Blazer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi-yo-Silver!

dialogues.speaker: KATHRYN
dialogues.text: Sees them and leaps off the whale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sean! She hops out of the tank and warmly embraces Sean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MMMM.  It's good to see you again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (meaning Mike)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You really gonna marry this guy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I can't wait for you forever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?  Younger guys are in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, you two, have a good life without me.  I gotta go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't hurry back. Mike leaves.  Kelly turns to Kathryn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doctor Allen, you think I could ride the whale sometime?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, Kelly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That'd be great.  I was a seal once, in another life, and whales were always my closest friends. They look at her.  Uh-huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike's there with Harris and Calvin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why didn't you stay with him? You never let a diver go down alone!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were done, Mike.  He left a piece of equipment down there and went back for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And hasn't been seen since.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I waited for him.  When he didn't show, I went back.  There's no sign of him.  His gear's still on deck.  I went in looking for him.  All I found was this. We see the missing three-quarter socket wrench.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't understand.  Overman's too good a diver to disappear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you checked the bars?  The guy's irresponsible;  he's done this before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Mr. Calvin.  We've called all over.  Nobody's seen him and his truck's still here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want him found.  He could be in the bars, he could be shacking up.  He could be out to sea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll need more men to look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't help you, Mike.  Don't have the manpower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going to have to cover the entire lagoon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, but you're just going to have to find another way.  So you better start. Calvin leaves.

dialogues.speaker: SUBMARINE AT DOCK
dialogues.text: A small two-seater, bobbing on the surface near the dolphin pen.  Kathryn turns to RUTH, one of her assistants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think they'll come out now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They still seem nervous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. Mike turns to Kathryn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're coming with us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We play hide and seek all the time.  They find a lot of things. Mike looks at the tiny sub.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (skeptically)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the rubber band?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, Michael... you don't have to come.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have a choice. She understands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, let's go then. They ease into the sub.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many coupons is this ride?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He squeezes into the front seat.  She's behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do I do now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take a deep breath and hold it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's cute, Kathryn.  Real cute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just put your mask on. He inserts his respirator while she starts the engine. She puts her mask on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Control, we're preparing to leave the dock now with the sub.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of the CONTROLLERS responds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger.  We'll keep an eye out for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kathryn pulls the canopy CLOSED.  It shuts with a BANG.  The sub starts filling with water.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Watching through his mask as the water surrounds him. The claustrophobia sets in.

dialogues.speaker: SUB
dialogues.text: Eases away from the dock and starts its journey, sinking from view.

dialogues.speaker: SUB
dialogues.text: Drifts down into the lagoon, spotlight on, scanning the beautiful underwater garden.

dialogues.speaker: CAMERA
dialogues.text: Something is FOLLOWING IT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike looks very apprehensive, and Kathryn knows it. He holds on tight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey... you all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you scared?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. They settle into the water. SUDDENLY, from NO PLACE

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY AND DAISY DOLPHIN
dialogues.text: Come SWOOPING INTO IT, their faces at the sub's window, scaring the shit out of Mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reacting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baby goddamn scared me to death!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They just wanted to say hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (low, to himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Friggin' fish. He takes a deep breath and holds on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's head to the gate and work our way back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a lot of ground to cover.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, I built it.  I've just never seen it this way.

dialogues.speaker: WALRUS EXHIBIT
dialogues.text: Sean and Kelly are peering into the tank.  A big old, whiskery WALRUS shoots up, SPITTING water on them. The kids get a bath.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN AND KELLY
dialogues.text: Dripping wet, laughing.  So is the walrus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I needed a cold shower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on!  Check this out! Kelly takes Sean's hand, and they skip away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moves through an underwater coral forest with an unlit glass TUNNEL extending through it.  The dolphins follow.

dialogues.speaker: SUB
dialogues.text: A slow-moving fish, sneaking past the fake cave openings.  The spotlight searches, lighting the shades of pink, white, and lavender formations.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE AND KATHRYN
dialogues.text: Eyes searching as she turns the spotlight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's romantic down here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah.  Very.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, on our honeymoon, we should go scuba diving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's not talk about that now, okay?

dialogues.speaker: SPANISH GALLEON
dialogues.text: Wrecked in 1982, it looks like it's been down here for centuries.  Masts broken, cannons rusting, wood eaten away.  The sub circles it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sub comes in low.  Nothing there, other than "priceless gold and treasure."  The sub moves in close as

dialogues.speaker: DOLPHINS POP OUT
dialogues.text: Frightening both of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now I'm getting paranoid!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Underwater, with enormous windows overlooking the lagoon.  On one entire wall is a schematic showing the electrical system of Sea Kingdom, lights flickering on it.  There are also banks of instrument panels and TV monitor screens.  In the b.g. is a lock which connects the lagoon with the control room.  A crew of men and a woman are working in the room.  Outside, the submarine appears. A man at one of the control panels throws a switch activating radio communication between the control room and the sub as a BUZZER sounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any luck?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We haven't seen anything either. Not a sign of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let us know.

dialogues.speaker: STADIUM STANDS
dialogues.text: Sean and Kelly sit in the top row now.  They're the only ones there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is where to be.  High and dry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And alone. They kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kathryn works the controls, but the sub starts SINKING!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (apprehensive)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. She's flicking all the switches.  The sub hits the bottom hard.  He watches her try the controls again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... If nothing's wrong, why are we stopping here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Electrical connection malfunctioning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sound like Houston Mission Control.  What the hell does it mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That we swim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (aghast)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Swim where?  Out there?  Oh, no, forget it, not me!  You go, I'm staying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael, the sub's dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, and so will I be if I start swimming in that blackass jungle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, stay.  We'll come back for you. She gets ready to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And leave me down here???

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (getting impatient)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make up your mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What mind?  If I had a mind, I'd never have let you talk me into this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I talked you into this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd have fallen in love with a pilot or a mountain climber.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you coming...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I don't want to leave now. I'm having too good a time... Of course I'm coming!  You'd think you're gonna leave me? They start to evacuate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You would, wouldn't you?  I'd end up whale shit, you wouldn't care.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get your reserve bottle and let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike and Kathryn emerge and start swimming but the

dialogues.speaker: DOLPHINS
dialogues.text: Won't let them go into the direction they want.  Bobby and Daisy keep bumping them, refusing to let them go. Mike is getting pissed.  He pushes Bobby; Kathryn PUNCHES Mike.

dialogues.speaker: KATHRYN
dialogues.text: Grabs Mike and points in the direction they were heading.

dialogues.speaker: GREAT WHITE SHARK
dialogues.text: Ten feet of killer, coming at them.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Utter fear, his eyes terrified as he stares at the shark.

dialogues.speaker: FLASH CUT
dialogues.text: Young Michael Brody being yanked from the water an instant before the Great White can eat him up.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE, KATHRYN AND DOLPHINS
dialogues.text: Mike gaping at the o.s. shark as Kathryn grabs onto Daisy's fin and pulls her to Mike.  She gestures for him to take the fin.  He doesn't respond, looks at the shark.

dialogues.speaker: THE WHITE
dialogues.text: Coming closer, a chilling monster.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE, KATHRYN AND DOLPHINS
dialogues.text: Kathryn grabs Mike's hand and forcibly puts it on Daisy's dorsal fin, taps Daisy.  The dolphin and Mike are gone in a flash.  Looking at the shark, Kathryn feels for Bobby's fin, taps his head.  As quickly as Mike went, she is gone from view.

dialogues.speaker: RACE FOR SAFETY SEQUENCE
dialogues.text: Shots alternating between the dolphins, their speed reduced by the weight of pulling Mike and Kathryn, and the Great White in pursuit of them, getting closer and closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dolphins carry Mike and Kathryn through the narrow opening.  The instant they are inside, the Great White hurtles into FRAME and BANGS against the gate sides, too big to get through.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE AND KATHRYN SURFACE
dialogues.text: Scramble for dear life out of the water, rolling onto the dock.  They lie there, gasping, chests heaving. Mike slides over to Kathryn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think so.  I'm not sure... Are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm okay. He holds her close.  She's trembling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all right, baby.  We're safe...

dialogues.speaker: DAISY AND BOBBY DOLPHIN
dialogues.text: Break the surface, chatting away.  Mike and Kathryn look at them and smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, guys. The dolphins almost answer "that's okay, but watch it next time."  Mike helps Kathryn to her feet, and they walk away, arms around each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How the hell did it get in here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, they're horrible.  I hate them.  Did you see its eyes?  How black they are?  The look in them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't think about it.  It's over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's never over...  Here comes another six years of bad dreams.

dialogues.speaker: DOLPHINS
dialogues.text: Watch them walk away, then DIVE back into the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shark is looking for something to eat.  Finds it. Gulp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calvin's called an emergency meeting.  Mike, Kathryn, Philip.  Calvin's eating his dinner through SCENE. Ike and Shelly stand in b.g.  There's a heated discussion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you're saying is we have a Great White shark in the lagoon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And a missing man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unhappy combination.  Most likely one's inside the other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sharks are man-biters, Mister Hutton.  Not man-eaters --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cutting her off)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a load of codswopple.  A Great White doesn't fear man.  It doesn't fear beast.  It's an orgy of food and blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we can capture it.  I'd like to try.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's preposterous!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go on, Doctor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one's ever caught a Great White except indirectly in fishing nets. I want to dart it and keep it alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It would make a marvelous attraction;  the only Great White in captivity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confidently)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can get it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can get killed!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've handled sharks before. Bigger than this one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calvin, let me go down there and kill the bastard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing to Calvin)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'll chop up half a million dollars of your tropical fish in two minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calvin, I insist I be allowed to capture it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three hundred million years of evolution have created the greatest butcher the world's ever known.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's one of the world's greatest creatures.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A shark could have a hundred embryos in its sack.  You know how many are born?  Maybe five. They eat each other before birth! They're born killers!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The only Great White in captivity, Calvin.  All those people standing in line...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, Kathryn.  Go ahead and get it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, then I'm going to film it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like hell!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Calvin)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make a lovely item for "Good Morning, America"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely.  Good idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Calvin)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With those camera lights and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's going with you, Doctor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it will be too much distraction.  I don't want that many people in the water.  I'll go in, give it a belly shot, and get out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Philip will be there to film it.  Now that's the end of it! Kathryn bites her lip, realizing.  She turns to Calvin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want that shark alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So do I, love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you'd better get started! He walks away.  Kathryn stares at Philip, who smiles and moves off with his men.  Mike comes up to Kathryn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going down there again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After what happened to us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know I can capture it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kathryn, you're crazy.  Really crazy.  A suicidal maniac.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The WORKBOAT comes through the darkening fog.  It's very moody.  Back lit, all that stuff.

dialogues.speaker: RUTH AND BRIAN
dialogues.text: Are preparing a large syringe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twelve cc's

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That should do it.

dialogues.speaker: OVER TO PHILIP AND SHELLY
dialogues.text: Preparing their cameras.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll shoot this with an .18, boys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That bugger moves fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me a 400-foot magazine;  we may be down there for a while.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't mind going down with her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is a lovely bit of crumpet at that.

dialogues.speaker: OVER TO MIKE
dialogues.text: Welding some kind of object.  Ike comes up to him. Ike's in his diving suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aren't you suiting up, mate?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, don't worry about your fiancee.  We'll watch over her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She can take care of herself. She doesn't need you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never know down there.  Helps to have a friend, sometimes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many sharks have you killed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me?  I don't know.  Twenty, thirty.  I love them, think they're the greatest. He walks away.  Mike looks out at the water, staring at it.

dialogues.speaker: FLASH
dialogues.text: Young Mike Brody sees the lifeguard taken by the shark.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO MIKE
dialogues.text: He comes out of it in a gasping sweat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, how do I look? He turns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: KATHRYN
dialogues.text: Wears an iron CHAIN LINK SUIT over her diving suit. She has a light-hearted nervousness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you like it? She models it for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah.  Really nice.  Who's your designer?  Sassoon Shark?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got it on sale. (touches links)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A real steel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bracelets. It's what he's been welding.  Forearm protectors which he places on her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine piece of engineering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should protect you a little, from the compression.  If that thing gets ahold of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. She kisses him.  He takes her in his arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kathryn...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes? He looks at her.  Wants to tell her to take that damn suit off.  To get off this boat and forget the fucking shark.  To go home with him, to bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I love you. She smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Love you too. Mike nods and takes his beeper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, hit it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The team of OPERATORS are at the instrument panel, all the monitor screens are on.  They flick some switches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let us know as soon as you have anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right, Mike.

dialogues.speaker: LAGOON
dialogues.text: Like a flower of sunshine unfolding, lights pop on from beneath the water, illuminating the lagoon.

dialogues.speaker: WORKBOAT
dialogues.text: Mike and Kathryn watch the lights come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wouldn't this whole thing be a little safer in the daytime?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's easier to lure sharks at night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?  'Cause they're hungrier?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're always hungry.  They eat anything. Philip enters.  He's wearing a bright orange diving suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing; touches her suit)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... even steel. Mike looks again at her protective suit.  She looks at Philip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look like an orange worm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shark bait.  Draws them over for closeups.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What in hell is that? She points to a

dialogues.speaker: HAND GRENADE
dialogues.text: Strapped on his waist, right by his large knife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lunch for Whitey.  Something to munch on in case things get dicey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're taking that shark alive!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's hope he knows that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know it and I will not go down into this lagoon as long as you carry that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I don't trust you, that's why.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You set that thing off down there, you don't know what will happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precisely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I insist you get rid of that bomb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Afraid I can't do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're supposed to film it, not turn it to hash!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, Doctor, this isn't one of your pet porpoises we're after. It's a torpedo of muscle. Murderous expertise!  I've seen bleeding sharks try to eat themselves!  Don't be so concerned about them.  Worry about yourself. He turns to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hutton! He stops.  Turns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You heard the lady.  Take it off. Tense pause.  Philip stares at Mike.  At Kathryn. Then his hand moves to the grenade.  He unclips it, holds it in his hand, and

dialogues.speaker: FLINGS IT TO MIKE
dialogues.text: Who catches it.  Philip walks away, smirking.  Mike makes a move after him, but Kathryn stops him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of the Operators sees something on a screen.  He focuses in on it.

dialogues.speaker: TV SCREEN
dialogues.text: It's the shark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see him, Mike.  Between the stadium and the ski show island.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, hit those lights too.

dialogues.speaker: MORE LIGHTS
dialogues.text: Start popping on.

dialogues.speaker: WORKBOAT
dialogues.text: Mike turns to Kathryn.  Tightens her tank straps. She holds a large SPEAR GUN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Change your mind?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You amaze me.  I'm more scared than you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you're not. Mike pulls her face mask down and "kisses" her over it.  She goes over the side.

dialogues.speaker: PHILIP AND IKE
dialogues.text: In their tanks and masks, ready to go.  Mike comes over to Philip.  Gives him back the grenade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here.  Don't let anything happen to her. Philip smiles and nods, clips the grenade to his waist and dives, taking us

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kathryn and Philip and Ike all start kicking down.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE ON WORKBOAT
dialogues.text: Watches the bubbles break the surface.  He turns to Shelly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is ridiculous.  We should blow the mother's head off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Couldn't agree more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the three kick downward.  Philip and Ike prepare to film.  Kathryn notices Philip checking his power- head and reacts sharply.  He notices and gives her a mocking salute, making her angrier yet.  Turning, she starts toward the circling shark.

dialogues.speaker: THE SHARK SEQUENCE
dialogues.text: Intercutting between Kathryn, Philip and Ike and, on the deck of the workboat,  Mike and Shelly.  Kathryn moves toward the shark until it starts to circle her, Philip and Ike beginning to film. Her expert maneuvering is not lost on Philip, and he watches with interest -- Mike, on the boat deck, watches what he can with apprehension -- as Kathryn slowly lures the shark toward her. Suddenly, it darts in at her and she jabs the spear at it (into the audience), causing it to veer away. Kathryn seems surprised by this.  The shark begins to circle her again, CAMERA PANNING with her as she keeps an eye on it.  Philip and Ike keep filming, Mike keeps watching tensely on the deck as Kathryn positions herself, holding the spear extended, moving it back and forth. Abruptly, the shark darts in, moving so precipitously that it goes all the way to Kathryn.  She ducks and the shark's jaws clamp shut on her air tanks.  Philip reacts to this and starts forward to help her as the shark begins to shake her violently from side to side. Letting go of the spear, she tries to hit the shark in the eye but has no success.  Philip shows up, and she waves him off.  He cannot believe her reaction but doesn't draw his powerhead, only hitting the shark on the head with the camera.  This makes it let go of Kathryn's tanks and back off fast.  Philip shoving it aside as it passes him, drawing his powerhead just to be safe.  The shark does not attack him though, but retreats.  Philip looks at Kathryn.  She is shaken up, but the chain-mail suit has protected her from injury. She waves him back irritably.  Shaking his head either at her or her stupidity, he backs off to Ike, keeping a wary eye on the shark as Kathryn kicks up to the surface to get another spear.  On deck, Mike tries to speak to her as she grabs the spear, but she is under again before he can say a word.  Kathryn grimly sets herself again.  Seeing this, Philip casts his eyes heavenward, as though thinking, "Dear God, the woman's suicidal."  She jabs the spear toward the still lingering shark.  Finally, after making a few nervous passes, it goes for her.  This time, she is able to shoot the sedating spearhead into its stomach, then kicks up toward the surface as fast as she can, the shark starting after her.

dialogues.speaker: SURFACE
dialogues.text: As she breaks through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael! Mike and Shelly rush there, reach down, and grab her hands to haul her up.  As they do, the shark comes after her.  They yank her over the railing an instant before it lunges out of the water and almost bites her feet off, jaws slamming shut in close shot as it misses, its body crashing back into the water. Kathryn looks at Mike, her face decidedly pale.  She attempts to smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (meekly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...  I told you I'd get it. The shark bellies up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can use a shot of what he's got.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Me, too. Her legs go watery, and she leans against the railing. Mike embraces her.

dialogues.speaker: CEILING
dialogues.text: The roof has been opened, and the shark is being lowered into the room on the litter.  CAMERA DOWNPANS with it to reveal Brian and Ruth preparing to get the shark into the tank, Philip, Shelly, and Ike filming it.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE AND KATHRYN
dialogues.text: He is drying her off with a large towel, rubbing her down good.  She is cold and shivering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After this has opened, when everything's settled down, you and I are going away.  Just the two of us.  No dolphins, no sharks, no whales, no penguins. Just you and me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds wonderful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll go to Palm Springs, Death Valley, Arizona desert, anyplace where there's no water. She kisses him and turns at a familiar SOUND.

dialogues.speaker: DOLPHINS
dialogues.text: In an adjoining tank, curiously watch the shark being lowered.  The dolphins chatter away.  Kathryn tells them:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be afraid, it's okay now. The dolphins don't believe her.  They dive for safety.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO MIKE AND KATHRYN
dialogues.text: Smiling.  She shrugs off the towel as Brian calls her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're ready for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to walk him till the drug wears off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want me to stay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (kissing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get some sleep.  And tell Sean I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (remembering)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sean, that's right... Mike turns to leave, accidentally crossing in front of Philip's shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch it, Brody.  You're ruining the shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kind of dull in there for you, isn't it?  Why don't you throw in another shark? He walks out. Kathryn hurries into the tank with Brian and Ruth. They unfasten the shark from the litter and start to walk it.  The litter is raised back up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a young one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And big for his age. They walk on.

dialogues.speaker: GRASSY KNOLL
dialogues.text: Sean and Kelly are lying on the ground making out as Mike's voice comes over the park P.A. system.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sean.  Sean, where are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone's looking for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's Mike.  Let him look. He kisses her some more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sean?  You there? Kelly gets to her feet, pulling Sean up too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, it's getting late, and I have an early call. They walk off, arms around each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ruth sleeps on a floor mat.  Kathryn and Brian are still walking the shark.  Both look very tired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you take a rest, Brian?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm only walking him.  You caught him.  You have to be exhausted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go on, you're tired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm fine, thanks. They stop talking, keep walking.

dialogues.speaker: PHILIP
dialogues.text: Comes in, wearing his jogging suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's sleeping beauty?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still sleeping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kiss him, maybe he'll turn into a frog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should be coming out of it soon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just watch it when he does. Philip lowers himself into the water and moves to Brian.  Taps him on the shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I cut in? Brian looks over at Kathryn, who's about to say no, then nods it's okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's all yours. Philip takes his place alongside the shark.  He smiles at Kathryn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could be a new dance...  Walking the Shark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling back)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for helping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like it when they wake up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So do I.  But for different reasons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I like you. They keep walking it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were quite daring in capturing him.  Very skillful indeed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Skillful?  I missed my first shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some miss all their shots.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somebody could have gotten hurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what life is, Doctor. Full of chances to hurt yourself, or somebody else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a strange man, Mr. Hutton.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Philip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before, you were ready to feed this shark a hand grenade.  Now you're helping to nurse it back to life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's because I am the shark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're all from the sea, Mr. Hutton. Our destiny is linked to the fate of the oceans.  By continuing to destroy fish, man destroys himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The grenade's just to intimidate Whitey.  He knows I have it, so he watches out.  Same is true when I film lions, tigers, rhinos... She studies his smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think that you and I are natural enemies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And here I thought I was charming you. The shark quivers, showing signs of waking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello.  I think his nap's over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get ready to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Believe me, I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calls)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian, he's coming around! They walk it a little more and

dialogues.speaker: THE SHARK AWAKENS
dialogues.text: Comes INSTANTLY back to life with an EXPLOSIVE recovery. Kathryn and Philip leap aside to get out of there, but the shark SLAMS Kathryn against the side of the tank, knocking the breath out of her.

dialogues.speaker: PHILIP INTERVENES
dialogues.text: So does Brian, who comes jumping into the tank.  Philip uses his feet to keep the shark away from Kathryn, but they both almost get CRUSHED by the body.  Philip flips her out of the tank as the shark comes lunging around at him.

dialogues.speaker: PHILIP
dialogues.text: Gets out of there just in time, as the shark just misses chomping his evacuating ass.  Brian's out of there safe.

dialogues.speaker: KATHRYN AND PHILIP
dialogues.text: Look down as the shark swims in rapid circles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, Doctor.  You've got your shark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks to you. There's a near moment of tender contact between them. Philip smiles and nods at her and leaves, doing his best Bobby Darin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (singing "Mack the Knife")

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh when the shark bites, With his teeth, dear, Scarlet billows start to spread... She watches him with an intrigued smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kathryn comes quietly in.  Starts undressing in the dark.  Mike softly speaks to her from the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All well in the Kingdom of the Sea? She smiles and sits on the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's your patient?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Recovering nicely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me, too. She falls into his arms, and they kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mmmm... you smell good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's my new perfume.  Great White, the Man-Eater. She nibbles his ear, neck.  He pulls her down to him, they kiss passionately.

dialogues.speaker: LAGOON
dialogues.text: All is still and quiet.  A NOISE is heard from beneath the water.  A faint almost ROAR, and the water is shaken by a giant form that sends a wave rolling to the CAMERA.  Then, whatever it was turns and returns to the deep.  The surface of the water rocks and trembles.

dialogues.speaker: SHARK ATTACK
dialogues.text: They're in a feeding frenzy.  They rip, tear, chewing on tuna, each other.  Anything in the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Playful bastards, wouldn't you say?

dialogues.speaker: REVEALING
dialogues.text: Philip and Ike and Shelly watching the footage on a Moviola screen.  They drink beer and watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brings back such pleasant memories.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was a rather enjoyable afternoon, wasn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to show this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely.  The audience will stain their drawers. (smiles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did. He walks for the door.  Opens it.

dialogues.speaker: PHILIP
dialogues.text: Stands outside his EXHIBIT BOOTH, taking in the start of a new day.  There's photos and signs:  PHILIP HUTTON PRESENTS KILLERS OF THE DEEP.  There's books and T- shirts and toys too.  Ike joins him outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gonna be a beautiful day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And a profitable one. They smile at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on,  I'll buy you breakfast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As final last-minute preparations are made. A.  Mini-buses being washed and decorated. B.  Sea shows in final rehearsal. C.  The Skiers getting dressed. D.  The mini-sub being worked on at the dock. E.  Food trucks delivering. F.  The ushers and usherettes, looking good. G.  Divers reaching the lagoon. H.  Control Room Underwater -- all is ready for lift- off. I.  Maintenance crews washing, scrubbing, polishing.

dialogues.speaker: TWO DIVERS
dialogues.text: Come up.  They shake their heads "nothing."  They dive again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Activating one of the symbol controls again and again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike and BOB talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've been looking all night, Mike.  I don't think he's out there.  If he drowned, I think he went down on the bay side of the gate and the current pulled him out.  It was pretty strong when the men were working there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you look in the intake passage?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't even get in there, the incoming flow is so strong.  It would wash the body out anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I don't know.  Maybe he isn't down there.  Keep checking with everyone who knows him. I'll be at my office. He leaves.

dialogues.speaker: ENTRANCE TO SHARK ENCOUNTER TUNNEL
dialogues.text: Mike's walking as Kathryn comes from the other side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike! He turns and she skips up to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They said you'd be here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need more pressure in the shark tank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to make sure the White is getting enough flow.  Would you do that for me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.  Let's go. She stops him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, we'll go through here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Mean through the tubes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  It's faster. MIKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No,  I'm not going through there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael, come on, don't be silly. This is the quickest way.  You're not going to walk all the way around?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not going to walk through that shark arcade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're not going to hurt you. They're encased in plastic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to see them, Kathryn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael, I don't have time. Please!  It's time you dealt with this and got over it.  Now come on! She takes his hand and leads him into the tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: SHARK TUNNEL
dialogues.text: Mike is very apprehensive as the SHARKS encroach upon them from all angles.  He can't look at them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calvin wants me to move the White for tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... He ought to put him in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's too soon to move him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So tell Calvin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did.  He wants it on exhibit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, that's why you got it. They walk on a bit, then Mike leans against the tunnel wall, eyes closed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike... you okay? He's taking deep breaths.  He's very pale and perspiring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's back... She goes to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's back? He's fighting some inner demon, and losing.  The sharks come swimming by him.  He stares them in the eye.  There seems to be thousands of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, what is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hydrophobia...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael, take deep breaths.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to get out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't take water, Kathryn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, you can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't!  My dad had it, and I don't know if you can inherit it or what, but I got it, and I hate it.  I can't stand it! He RUNS out of there, running for his life, leaving her behind.  She watches him go.

dialogues.speaker: MOVE FROM THEM THROUGH THE WINDOW
dialogues.text: Out into the water.  A shark.  We move in on its black eye, till the eye fills the SCREEN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The same size as the eye in the previous shot, ROARING as the cannon is fired.  CAMERA PULLS BACK to reveal the cannon on the deck of a motorized pirate vessel which is carrying on its deck a gathering of politicians, press representatives, TV newsmen, and celebrities.  It sails across the lagoon, flags whipping in the wind, cannons THUNDERING.  CAMERA PANS UP and we see the words THE NEW SEA KINGDOM WELCOMES YOU moving across the sky, towed by a single-engine plane.

dialogues.speaker: CROWD ARRIVING
dialogues.text: The great American Tourist invasion.  They come in cut- offs and sandals, Kodaks and sunglasses.  They come in every size, shape, and colored getup.  Old and young, they CHARGE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome to Sea Kingdom, and the excitement and discovery of earth's inner space.  For the whale and dolphin shows, please stay to the right.  The underwater tunnels are straight ahead...

dialogues.speaker: THREE MERMAIDS
dialogues.text: Very pretty in their fishtail suits.  They answer the tourists' questions.

dialogues.speaker: SEA KINGDOM
dialogues.text: As we come floating over the park.

dialogues.speaker: PHILIP
dialogues.text: Dangling out of the HOT AIR BALLOON, filming.  Ike is the pilot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hardly like the Falklands. Philip calls over the bullhorn to the gaping tourists below:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you'll all squeeze a bit closer, everybody, you can see yourself tonight on the evening news.

dialogues.speaker: FAT WOMAN TOURIST
dialogues.text: A 200-pounder in shorts, hat, and sunglasses squeezes into the shot.  She looks up, smiling and waving at the hot air balloon.  She shoves in closer, loses her balance, and falls into the lagoon.

dialogues.speaker: PHILIP
dialogues.text: Watches woman splashing about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, seems a new whale show has been added. They laugh.

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE GIRL CRYING
dialogues.text: She's scared of the performing WALRUS.  Her mother comforts her.

dialogues.speaker: WATER SKIERS
dialogues.text: Come BURSTING through the sign like John Madden in the Lite Beer commercial.  The skiers are in their pyramid formation.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: As usual, is fighting for balance.  Teetering on the edge, she lets out a desperate warning cry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna fall, I'm gonna fall!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Kelly!  Jesus, you can't!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahh---  Ohhh----

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back, Kelly.  Lean back!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ohhhhh shhhhiiiit. There she goes. No, she doesn't. Yes, she does. Nope, still up there. Hang on, Kel.

dialogues.speaker: CROWD
dialogues.text: Applauding the skiers as they come zooming by in formation.

dialogues.speaker: SKIERS
dialogues.text: Make their sweeping turn and head in to shore.  They come neatly out of the pyramid.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Makes a graceful 3-point landing, gliding onto the dock.  She EXPLODES in joy, all bubbly and happy, thrilled at her accomplishment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did it,  I did it! She leaps on Tod, hugging him exuberantly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Way to go, Kelly! You were great!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew I could do it! They all slap palms and give high-fives and hugs. Kelly is the center of the adulation.

dialogues.speaker: MONSTERS OF THE DEEP FUN TUNNEL
dialogues.text: Everyone enjoying the scary walk.  We see the giant squid tentacles reaching over the glass.  Kids scream. Now it seems as if one tentacle has actually BROKEN THROUGH, but it's only an illusion.  An EEL flies out of a cave and charges.

dialogues.speaker: THREE TEENAGE GIRLS
dialogues.text: Screaming, yelling, giggling as they react to the ravenous "monster."  The girls are LINDA, BECKY, and ALI.  They love it.

dialogues.speaker: TOURISTS
dialogues.text: Moving happily along.  They eat, take pictures, push strollers.  Everybody's having fun.

dialogues.speaker: DAISY AND BOBBY
dialogues.text: Doing their act for the laughing, clapping crowd. Kathryn looks pleased.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the gauges and dials and monitors registering.

dialogues.speaker: OPERATOR
dialogues.text: Looks at one flashing gauge.  He calls his partner over.  They look a bit concerned as they check it.

dialogues.speaker: KATHRYN RUNNING THROUGH THE CROWD
dialogues.text: She forces her way through those in line to see the live "Great White Shark."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
