dialogues.text: Excuse me, sorry.  Let me through, please.  I have to get through!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian and Ruth are walking the shark.  The exhibit is PACKED with tourists, gaping down, watching.

dialogues.speaker: KATHRYN
dialogues.text: Bursts through onto the floor, kicking her shoes off on the run.  She jumps into the tank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When did this happen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ten minutes ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It hasn't adjusted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get the hose!  We've got to force more water through the gills and oxygenate him! Brian scampers out of the tank for the hose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew it;  it's my fault.  We moved it too soon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't blame yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should have never listened to Calvin. They walk the shark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kathryn...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Goddamn it. The shark is dead.  It floats over, belly up.

dialogues.speaker: KATHRYN
dialogues.text: Takes a painful moment, looking at the shark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one's ever done it before. It was a good try...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not good enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got it to live for ten hours. That's some kind of record. She turns from the shark and looks up at all the

dialogues.speaker: TOURISTS
dialogues.text: Gaping down, taking pictures, grumbling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big deal. Let's get our money back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, Mommy, the shark's dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, dear.  Come on. They start to leave with the others.  Some still stare and wait.

dialogues.speaker: KATHRYN
dialogues.text: The disappointment and disgust is evident.  Brian puts a comforting arm around her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't feel bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (resigned)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay... Have them get it out of the tank. She climbs out of the tank.

dialogues.speaker: SEA LION SHOW
dialogues.text: The audience laughs.

dialogues.speaker: KILLER WHALE SHOW
dialogues.text: It leaps and dives, having as good a time as the tourists.

dialogues.speaker: SHOTS OF PARK
dialogues.text: The tourists going from one show to the next.

dialogues.speaker: BACKSTAGE SKI SHOW
dialogues.text: Mike and Sean stand to the side as the girls hurry past them, changing costumes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike, this is fantastic.  I mean, you're responsible for building all this.  What a job you've done! Maybe I'll quit school and come down here and work with you. Brody Brothers Construction. We've always wanted to do that together.  Boat building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not that easy.  Worked construction every summer to get through school.  Three years apprentice in the park's engineering department, and two years to build all this.  Finish school first, Sean.  Then make up your mind.  If you still want to work with me, we'll have plenty of time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You and Kathryn gonna stay here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This company's expanding.  They got parks in Texas, Ohio, California.  I think I'm gonna be going to Waco.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, Dad asked me to ask you this, about the wedding.  Is there any chance you and Kathryn will get married in Amity?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell Dad we're getting married in Las Vegas.  In one of those chapels.  He can meet us there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, he'll really go for that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all up to Kathryn.  Amity's fine with me if it's fine with her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sean! Sean looks over as he hears his name called.  Kelly's running over to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She still talking to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're in love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, really.  I've never met anyone like her before.  This is it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, right.  That's what you said about Janet, and Beth, and Barbara --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Puppy love.  This time it's real! We can have a double wedding. Kelly is upon them.  She's in her warm-up suit and looks adorable.  Sean greets her with a hug and a kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were great out there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you see me?!  Wasn't I terrific?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As always. They kiss again.  Kelly sees Mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How you doing, Kelly?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sniffling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Neo-Senephrened out.  Think I'm catching a cold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better than catching Sean's herpes. An astounded glare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Herpes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why you sonuvabitch...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (leaving)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See you tonight. Mike smirks away as Kelly grabs Sean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sean, do you have herpes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  Of course not.  Don't listen to him.  He's - he's... (laughing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... my brother. They kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not in the next show.  What do you want to do? He looks at her and grins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Besides that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, what else is there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (excitedly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know!  We can take the gondola ride!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The one that goes underwater?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, it's great!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Kelly, I don't want to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, it's fun!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not for me.  I don't go in the water, remember?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not in the water.  You're in a gondola.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, think of something else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sean, this is ridiculous.  You're acting very immature.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not acting!  I don't want to go in it, okay? She's dragging him by the hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I do!  Time you got over this wet dream.  Nothing's gonna hurt you.  Now c'mon, we're going on it! He very reluctantly goes with her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kids and adults laughing and jumping at the creatures from the deep.

dialogues.speaker: OUR THREE TEENAGE GIRLS
dialogues.text: Linda, Becky, and Ali ask the ATTENDANT at the entrance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this one scary?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  This one's fun.  You'll like it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, good.  Because the last one really scared us. They head into the tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Woman Controller sees something on one of the monitors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you see that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On monitor three.  Was a glimpse of something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, there is goes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's disappeared. They wait and watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll have the guard look. She picks up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: ATTENDANT AT TUNNEL
dialogues.text: He's on the phone to Control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll go check on it. He hangs up and starts down the tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: OUR THREE TEENAGE GIRLS
dialogues.text: Having a good time as a giant, mad-eyed squid appears with all its tentacles reaching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow, look at that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  Reminds me of my date last night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, look at that thing over there.  What's that supposed to be? They press to the glass for a closer look.  We see some kind of FORM, floating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.  Some kind of crab?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It looks like a man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is!

dialogues.speaker: THE FORM
dialogues.text: Rolls over as the girls SCREAM in horror.  We see it is

dialogues.speaker: OVERMAN
dialogues.text: What's left of him.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY JONES LOCKER
dialogues.text: Mike sits at the bar, on a stool.  He's had a few, and it shows.  There's a good crowd in the restaurant.

dialogues.speaker: PHILIP, IKE, AND SHELLY ENTER
dialogues.text: Move for a spot.  Philip spots Mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See you later, mates. Philip moves over to Mike.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE AND PHILIP AT BAR
dialogues.text: Philip puts an arm around Mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your friend Overman picked a hell of a time to come back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, poor bastard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I lost a good cameraman in Australia last year.  A Great White chopped him in half with one bite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I don't want to hear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's how they do it, you know. Seizes its prey and shakes its body savagely.  Teeth gnaw through a man like a buzz saw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buzz off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will, old boy, tomorrow.  Our work is done here.  Just came to say goodbye, and good luck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?  Well, in that case, have a drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. (to girl bartender)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullshot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So where you go off to, Hutton? Some expedition in New Guinea or Outer Mongolia?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, South Georgia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell's there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Polar bears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Polar bears in Georgia???

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: South Georgia, Antarctica.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The world's southern most reaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How come you're so brave with all this stuff?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tradition.  Royal sense of adventure that's been in my family for centuries.  Dates back to the Crusades and King Richard.  What I was born to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, tradition's a bitch, ain't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reach for the limit I always say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll remember that, my Lordship.

dialogues.speaker: KATHRYN ENTERS
dialogues.text: She takes a beat, looks around, and moves quickly to the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael. They both look at her as she comes up to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael, look at this. She shows us what's in her hand.

dialogues.speaker: A VERY BIG SHARP TOOTH
dialogues.text: Mike looks at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put it under your pillow and sleep on it and the tooth fairy will --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a shark's tooth!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was removed from Charlie Overman's body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I? He takes the tooth.  One look and he knows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... The bigger to eat you with. He and Kathryn exchange an understanding that Mike doesn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confused)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the big deal?  A shark got Overman, and we got the shark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's just it, Michael.  We don't!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean, we don't?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This tooth is from another shark. A shark that could be 30 feet long!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thirty feet???

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, thirty-five is probably more accurate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's impossible.  If it's that big, why hasn't anybody seen it? Huh?  Tell me that.  It's like not seeing the Goodyear blimp in a swimming pool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I've come to ask you. Is there any large place that has a strong current of water flowing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't understand. His BEEPER starts signaling.  He ignores it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sharks have to keep moving.  They can never stop or they'll suffocate. If water isn't always flowing through them, they'll die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there such a place?  A cave or something with such a flow?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know...  I can't think offhand of one. He reaches for his signaling beeper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, what is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Woman Controller is watching one of the rising gauges.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike, we got a heat build-up in filter system number four.  We're running high temperature.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Switch to intake three and keep it there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right, Mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOVING - CAMERA PANS across the gate.  The bubbles stop.  Through the grate, we SEE the GRAY FORM begin to move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you just say before? About water flowing through them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's why they're always moving. They have to have it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Philip)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanted to know about a cave?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Filter system number four.  Is it large enough?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (solemnly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's large enough...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dark cloud passing overhead, covering them in shadows.  We see the underside of a massive white shark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How far away is filter number four?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five hundred yards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have a man near it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somebody better get down there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all controlled from the Control Room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've heard of a White that big, in Australia...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd it get in here?!

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Slumps on his stool, head in his hands, half-bagged, mumbling low.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no... not again.  A thirty- five-foot fuckin' shark... Goddamn... what's wrong with my family?  First my father... now me...

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Sees something REFLECTED in his glass.  He leans forward, curiously, watching whatever it is growing larger and larger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell... He turns and SEES

dialogues.speaker: JAWS
dialogues.text: In all it's full, awesome, HORRIFYING form.  Mouth open, it tries to eat the viewing glass, then turns. Its body thunders against the window, shaking it as people SCREAM and panic for the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, my God!

dialogues.speaker: KATHRYN AND PHILIP
dialogues.text: Can't believe it themselves.  They stare in awe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's big as a bloody bus!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The water ski show!  We have to get them out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You two go!  I'll call Calvin!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike and Philip come jumping into Mike's golf cart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch it!  Out of the way! The tourists look at them.  Who are these rude men?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coming through, please! Philip is standing and screaming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Move your bloody asses! Mike tries to drive through-around the crowd.  They yell back at him.  Mike grabs his beeper and calls in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Brody, get the skiers out of the water!  We got a shark loose!  A Great White!

dialogues.speaker: THE SHARK
dialogues.text: Sweeping past one of the tunnels.  People run in fear. Total PANIC.

dialogues.speaker: WATER SKIERS
dialogues.text: They are doing "The Hatfields and McCoys."  The skiers are in mountaineer costumes, and the MUSIC is loud bluegrass as the skiers do their twists and turns.

dialogues.speaker: SKI SHOW AUDIENCE
dialogues.text: Stomping and clapping and cheering for their side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hatfields!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCoys!

dialogues.speaker: KATHRYN ON PHONE
dialogues.text: She's finally gotten Calvin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Calvin, yes!  It's the biggest shark I've ever seen.  A female.  I think the other one was hers.  You have to get the skiers out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up ahead, the skiers' wake.  The shark rises.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE AND PHILIP
dialogues.text: Now there are so many tourists in front of them, the cart is useless.  They jump out of it and RUN for the ski show stadium.  Those in their way get knocked aside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, where the hell you going?! Why don'tcha watch it?!  Asshole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slicing through the water, CAMERA draws around, revealing that the shark is heading for the lighted stadium, the ROAR of the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: SHOT OF THE SKI SHOW
dialogues.text: The audience applauds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Headed toward the stadium.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE AND PHILIP
dialogues.text: Come running in, in back of the stadium.  They hurry to where the other skiers wait backstage.

dialogues.speaker: PHILIP
dialogues.text: Looking toward the lagoon, sees something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Christ.

dialogues.speaker: THE FIN
dialogues.text: Heading toward the skiers.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE AND PHILIP
dialogues.text: Keep running, pointing, and yelling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shark!  Shark! But his warning is drowned out by the participating audience caught up in the show.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hatfields! McCoys! Mike grabs one of the show's MANAGERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get them in!  There's a shark out there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're kidding, aren't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get them out of the water!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus... He runs off, while Mike sprints for the Master of Ceremonies.

dialogues.speaker: WATER SKIERS
dialogues.text: Doing their twists, turns.

dialogues.speaker: SKIER
dialogues.text: Does a fancy turnabout.  Skiing backwards, he looks aghast as he spots something in the water coming after them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy shit! He completes his turn-around and skis on, looking back over his shoulder.  One of the GIRL SKIERS notices him looking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, what'd you lose?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh... nothing... just don't fall.  Just don't fall! He glances back again.  The fin follows, then dives beneath the surface.

dialogues.speaker: SKI SHOW
dialogues.text: The M.C. is giving the audience a running play-by-play commentary as Mike comes bursting upon him, grabbing the microphone.  The M.C. keeps pushing Mike back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?  I'm doing a show.  Give me that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into microphone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All skiers in!  There's a shark out there!  Get out of the water! There's a shark!

dialogues.speaker: AUDIENCE
dialogues.text: Almost in unison, EVERYBODY in the entire stadium rises to their feet, looking.

dialogues.speaker: WATER SKIERS
dialogues.text: Having heard Mike's announcement, they're all looking about with great concern.

dialogues.speaker: SKIER
dialogues.text: Does a JUMP, coming off a ramp.  Airborne, he glances down in disbelief as he FLIES over the monstrous form swimming beneath him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy shit! He lands and keeps going.

dialogues.speaker: SKIERS
dialogues.text: As the boat comes roaring in at top speed.  The skiers make their sliding breakaway and clamber up onto the pad and safety.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE AND PHILIP
dialogues.text: Are amongst those helping them out.  The skiers collapse thankfully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, that was close!

dialogues.speaker: GIRL SKIERS
dialogues.text: All out of breath, looking out at the lagoon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't see it. Where is it?

dialogues.speaker: UNDERWATER
dialogues.text: A GRINDING-SPLASHING NOISE has its attention.  It heads in that direction.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN ARRIVES
dialogues.text: Runs up and responds to

dialogues.speaker: SHARK FIN
dialogues.text: Speeding to one of the GONDOLA CARS as it glides along the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good God!

dialogues.speaker: GONDOLA CARS
dialogues.text: One rises up from the water as the next one descends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sean and Kelly sit holding hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't this fun!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (low, sarcastic)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can hardly wait to do it again. She laughs and kisses him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Told you you'd like it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (apprehensively)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now what's this do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goes up. Sean looks out at the water and sees

dialogues.speaker: THE FIN
dialogues.text: Knifing through the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (aghast)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No...  It can't be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, hon? Unable to speak, he can only point at the rapidly approaching dorsal fin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, my God!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The splashing Gondola Car.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN AND KELLY
dialogues.text: White-knuckled as the car starts to rise up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go, let's go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay, Sean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's diving!

dialogues.speaker: THE FIN
dialogues.text: Disappears.

dialogues.speaker: THE GONDOLA
dialogues.text: Slowly rises.  Now ten feet above the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (big sigh)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We made it.  It can't get us. Sean still stares through the glass bottom at the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take it up!

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: Kelly has reason to scream, for

dialogues.speaker: THE SHARK
dialogues.text: Comes BURSTING out of the water at them.

dialogues.speaker: SHARK
dialogues.text: Lunges high into the air, giant jaws open wide, rows of teeth bared.  It clamps down on the rising gondola.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN AND KELLY
dialogues.text: As they look into the jaws of death.  Kelly SCREAMS.

dialogues.speaker: SHARK AND GONDOLA
dialogues.text: As the car comes crashing back into the water, being torn apart by the giant.  Kelly's SCREAM is still heard.

dialogues.speaker: AMBULANCE SCREAMING
dialogues.text: It's SIREN crying out as the ambulance RACES through the street, light flashing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's doing seventy and WEAVING in and out of traffic, barely avoiding head-ons and blind-sides by inches.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Paces the hallway, nervously, outside a room.

dialogues.speaker: NURSE
dialogues.text: Comes out room door.  Mike goes up to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I see him now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's very sedated.  You can't talk to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just want to see him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only for a minute. Mike nods appreciatively and enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lies in bed with tubes sticking out of him.  Mike stands looking at his still brother.

dialogues.speaker: KATHRYN
dialogues.text: Enters.  Comes up to Mike, takes his hand.  Mike looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Kelly? Kathryn barely shakes her head "no."  Mike shows his pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Couple of fractures, lacerations. They say he's gonna be all right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I have to go, honey.  Phillip and I are going down together to kill the shark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Okay. She kisses his cheek and leaves.  Mike just keeps looking at his brother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kathryn, Calvin, Philip, and staff execs seated around the table-top model of the Kingdom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can assume he's back in the water intake passage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She, Mister Hutton.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He.  She.  Let's blow the bitch up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't do that.  We're talking millions of dollars of filtering system.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're talking a bloody dinosaur's down there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not going to blow that equipment away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, what else do you propose?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We net it... They all look to see

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Coming through the door, joining them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After all, that's how you catch fish, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could also try a bamboo pole and a worm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your plan, Brody?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's easy.  Put a net on the derrick.  Put the net in the water by the intake passage. Turn off the intake passage. Shark comes out into the net and is hauled up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A piece of pie on Sunday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The net would have to be secured by the intake passage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's going to do it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael, you're not going down there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am.  You're not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cutting her off)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a construction job.  I'm the only one that can do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll go with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll stay out of your way.  I won't interfere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure you won't.  But you're going to have to wait till we come up.  Then you can film all you want. He starts for the door as Kathryn grabs him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael, you don't have to go down there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want that shark, Kathryn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have to prove anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only to myself. She watches as he leaves.

dialogues.speaker: DERRICK
dialogues.text: A giant heavy-duty CRANE sits beside the shore.  It is strongly reinforced by supporting cables.  Nothing could budge this baby.

dialogues.speaker: GIANT NET
dialogues.text: Is fastened to the derrick beam and guided over to the water's edge by workers.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: In diving suit, overseeing the operation.  He moves about, hand signaling the crane operator to lower the net.

dialogues.speaker: NET
dialogues.text: Comes crashing into the lagoon, submerging to the deep.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Is with Bob, ready to go in.  He holds Kathryn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be careful. Mikes smiles at her and repeats her own words.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry.  I've handled sharks before. A quick kiss and he goes into the water.  Kathryn watches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike and Bob dive to the

dialogues.speaker: TUNNEL ENTRANCE
dialogues.text: Mike stops there, and Bob continues to the bottom.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Looking into tunnel.  PULL BACK to include ominous tail of shark.  It WIPES FRAME.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Signals for them to send down the equipment.

dialogues.speaker: SHORE
dialogues.text: Men lower the gear to the divers below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the gear comes down.

dialogues.speaker: BOB WITH JACK HAMMER
dialogues.text: Driving in anchor pins.  PULL BACK AND UP to

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Welding hook eyes to tunnel mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike is intense and worried as he welds.  ANGLE DOWN, the shark's tail is swishing, more agitated.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: Glances up toward the shark, concerned about the JACK HAMMER NOISE.  He suddenly startled by something touching him.

dialogues.speaker: REVERSE
dialogues.text: He's finished with the welding and motions for them to get the net assembly.

dialogues.speaker: CAMERA MOVES PAST THEM
dialogues.text: The shark is STIRRING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike and Bob move the assembly toward the tunnel mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They reach the tunnel mouth.

dialogues.speaker: HAND
dialogues.text: Attaching a cinch ring hook.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE AND BOB
dialogues.text: They maneuver about the mouth, from hook to hook.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To Bob swimming down to attach anchor pins to net.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike joins Bob. 259        CLOSE on SHIVES Being attached.

dialogues.speaker: JOB IS FINISHED
dialogues.text: Mike signals return to surface.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE AND BOB
dialogues.text: Quickly get the hell out of there.

dialogues.speaker: SURFACE
dialogues.text: Mike breaks through, followed by Bob.  They pull them- selves up onto shore.  Clasp hands tightly.  Machismo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Way to go, Bob.  Way to go!

dialogues.speaker: KATHRYN
dialogues.text: Hurries over to Mike.  She's greatly concerned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm  fine. They hug.

dialogues.speaker: PHILIP
dialogues.text: It's his turn now.  He grabs Ike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go. They start into the water.  Mike comes over to Philip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (warning)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's big, Hutton.  You never saw anything so big.  Watch yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Always do. They submerge into the water.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Grabs walkie-talkie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, turn them on.

dialogues.speaker: CONTROL ROOM
dialogues.text: As the lagoon lights start to be turned on.  We see them come on outside the windows.

dialogues.speaker: LAGOON
dialogues.text: As the lights come on, section by section.

dialogues.speaker: PHILIP AND IKE
dialogues.text: Reacting as the lights go on.  Immediately, Philip switches on his head lantern and begins to check the camera.  Ike looks uneasily toward the tunnel entrance.

dialogues.speaker: TUNNEL ENTRANCE
dialogues.text: The net across it, cables raising from each anchor pin. The shark cannot be seen inside the tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: PHILIP AND IKE
dialogues.text: Philip flathands Ike on the shoulder, startling him. He points to Ike's lights, and Ike nods jerkily, turns them on, turns on his head lantern.  Philip gestures for them to get closer to the center of the net.  Ike hesitates.  Again, Philip hits him on the shoulder, gestures impatiently.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: On the walkie-talkie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turn off the water.

dialogues.speaker: CONTROL ROOM
dialogues.text: As they begin to turn off the water entering the tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: SHOTS
dialogues.text: As the water current slows down in the tunnel.  The shark begins to stir.  The principals on shore wait, looking toward the lagoon.

dialogues.speaker: PHILIP AND IKE
dialogues.text: Philip gestures for them to get closer yet to the center of the net.  Ike holds back.  Philip gestures angrily, and Ike has to go along but is most unhappy about it.

dialogues.speaker: SHOTS
dialogues.text: The water current getting weaker and weaker.  The shark begins to move.  Philip wants to be closer yet. Ike holds back, and Philip grabs his arm, pulling him. Ike looks toward the tunnel with mounting dread.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Philip grabs Ike, pulling him closer.

dialogues.speaker: SHARK
dialogues.text: Slowly starts BACKING OUT.  Philip stays close, photo- graphing.  Ike drifts back.

dialogues.speaker: CONTROL ROOM
dialogues.text: The Operator watches the monitor closely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shark's backing out.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Turns to his crew.  Speaks into the walkie-talkie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's coming out.  Get ready.

dialogues.speaker: PHILIP
dialogues.text: Stays right on top of it as the shark continues to back out.  Philip looks over his shoulder and sees Ike taking off, terrified.

dialogues.speaker: CONTROL ROOM
dialogues.text: The shark's three-quarters out now.  Ike is leaving FRAME.

dialogues.speaker: PHILIP
dialogues.text: Obsessed, he continues to film, despite incredible risk.  The shark slowly, ominously backs up, backs up...

dialogues.speaker: SHARK
dialogues.text: Is now OUT of the tunnel.  Philip keeps filming.

dialogues.speaker: SHARK
dialogues.text: Suddenly SWINGS AROUND, its incredible, massive head now turned to Philip and CAMERA.  It is JAWS!

dialogues.speaker: PHILIP
dialogues.text: Stunned, backpedals frantically as the

dialogues.speaker: SHARK
dialogues.text: Thrashes forward into the NET.

dialogues.speaker: PHILIP
dialogues.text: Mesmerized.  Unable to stop, Philip brings camera up to resume filming.

dialogues.speaker: PINS
dialogues.text: They begin popping out.

dialogues.speaker: SHARK
dialogues.text: Comes HEAD ON, smashing into the net.

dialogues.speaker: CONTROL ROOM
dialogues.text: The Operator sees this chaos in the monitor and reports.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pins are going!

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Acts at once, speaking into the walkie-talkie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pull up the rear net lines!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The OPERATOR responds, pulling the levers hard.

dialogues.speaker: NET FLOATS
dialogues.text: Being hoisted out of the water.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Gives a new order.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too much, ease off, ease off!

dialogues.speaker: REAR OF SHARK IN NET
dialogues.text: The mighty tail is tearing back and forth.  Between the excessive pull-up and the thrashing tail, the strain on the anchor pins is too much.

dialogues.speaker: PIN
dialogues.text: Violently being pulled out by an unseen force.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tail's knocking out the bottom lines!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Crane Operator)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take up the cinch line on tunnel mouth!

dialogues.speaker: PHILIP
dialogues.text: Refuses to yield.  He's still in from of the shark, filming.  The shark's ENRAGED.

dialogues.speaker: ANCHOR PINS
dialogues.text: Start popping out in rapid order.

dialogues.speaker: PHILIP
dialogues.text: Realizes and starts retreating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harder on the cinch lines!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's full bore now!

dialogues.speaker: SHARK
dialogues.text: Its assault on the net is more frenzied than ever.  It plows into it.  The seam starts to go!

dialogues.speaker: CRANE
dialogues.text: The derrick starts to TOPPLE, bracing cables snapping, the rear wheels starting to lift.  Mike and everybody look around in SHOCK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Comes toppling toward CAMERA.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Sees and warns Bob.  Look out!  They LEAP into the water, barely avoiding the falling crane.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE CLOSE
dialogues.text: No mouthpiece, no mask up.  He's gagging for air.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: His foot and leg tangled in net and cinch line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike struggles to free himself.

dialogues.speaker: SHARK
dialogues.text: With tremendous thrust, the shark splits the seam of the net, coming right at us.  Its vast JAWS fill the screen.

dialogues.speaker: PHILIP
dialogues.text: Panic-stricken, total shock, he tries to escape.

dialogues.speaker: PHILIP SWIMMING
dialogues.text: The shark right behind.  It wants Philip BAD.

dialogues.speaker: IKE
dialogues.text: Looks down in horror as he sees

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Philip is scooped into the massive mouth.

dialogues.speaker: MOUTH
dialogues.text: Philip's airline is hooked over a shark's tooth as

dialogues.speaker: PHILIP
dialogues.text: slides into the shark's throat WHOLE.

dialogues.speaker: PHILIP INSIDE SHARK
dialogues.text: Panics as air is replaced by water, as he continues further into the shark.  He is still alive, in one piece, at the edge of INSANITY.  Then he remembers the

dialogues.speaker: GRENADE
dialogues.text: His hand gropes frantically for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Philip, arm extended with grenade, fights to free his pinned arm to pull the grenade pin.

dialogues.speaker: PHILIP
dialogues.text: His mask now filled with water, struggles, bug-eyed, as his breath give out.

dialogues.speaker: GRENADE
dialogues.text: In Philip's hand.  A dead man's grasp on the grenade as the mouth of the shark closes into blackness.

dialogues.speaker: IKE
dialogues.text: Surfaces near platform,  CAMERA moves in as

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: Surfaces unexpectedly in f.g., startling Ike.

dialogues.speaker: ANGLE ON MIKE
dialogues.text: He finds air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He clears mask, puts in his respirator, looks...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through mask as water clears, the shark coming around the tunnel toward Mike.

dialogues.speaker: SHARK
dialogues.text: Heading for Mike.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE PLATFORM
dialogues.text: Climbs out, exclaiming:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike's caught in the net lines!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Closing fast on Mike, still trapped.

dialogues.speaker: KATHRYN
dialogues.text: With Bob in b.g.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to roustabouts)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pull the cinch lines in!  Hurry!

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Suddenly yanked upside-down and out of the tangled flippe as the shark, on its kill run, lunges where Mike had been moments before.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Is bumped hard by the passing shark.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Swims down as the shark, overhead, turns.

dialogues.speaker: SURFACE
dialogues.text: Flipper, empty, is pulled from water.  CAMERA moves in on Kathryn, grief-stricken.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Perplexed, looks for way out.  Begins to swim down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cave.  We move toward it.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Looks over his shoulder at the pursuing shark.  It's gaining fast.  Mike's kicking as fast as he can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shark, closing in once again.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Swims frantically, the cave seeming so close yet so far.

dialogues.speaker: SHARK
dialogues.text: Alarmingly close, mouth open for the kill.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: At mouth of cave, desperately reaching for the lip. He swings into the cave... and out of the shark's path as

dialogues.speaker: THE HUGE BEAST
dialogues.text: Immediately surges past, crashing into the cave's entrance.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Reacts to the close call.

dialogues.speaker: MASSIVE TAIL
dialogues.text: Whips past, colliding with cave overhang, causing the overhang to fracture from the heavy blow.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: His face reflecting concern as light changes and there is a

dialogues.speaker: CAVE-IN
dialogues.text: We see that Mike is blocked by fallen debris.

dialogues.speaker: KATHRYN
dialogues.text: Grabs Bob as he is helped from the water.  Shelly pulls ashore a traumatized Ike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Michael?  What's happened to him? Bob shakes his head mutely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I don't know.  The shark got him. Kathryn grabs a walkie-talkie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you see Michael?

dialogues.speaker: CONTROL ROOM
dialogues.text: Man looking at the monitor screens for the Fun Tunnel area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look! CAMERA moves in fast on the screen to show the cave entrance.

dialogues.speaker: CAVE ENTRANCE
dialogues.text: Trying to pull loose some of the fallen concrete to get out, looking for the shark.  The concrete pieces are too heavy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We think he's trapped inside a cave beside the glass tunnel. The shark broke up the entrance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is the shark?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Near the bay gate. Kathryn hesitates, then runs out of FRAME, Bob and the others watching her go in surprise.

dialogues.speaker: SHOTS
dialogues.text: Kathryn running desperately toward her compound.  Mike trying, in vain, to get out of the cave.

dialogues.speaker: SHARK COMPOUND DOCK
dialogues.text: Running to the sub, untying it, jumping in, pulling the canopy shut, and turning on the engine.  As the SUB moves into the lagoon, she puts on the scuba mask.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY AND DAISY
dialogues.text: Seeing her leave, they begin to butt frantically at the still-unrepaired gate opening of their pen.

dialogues.speaker: SUB
dialogues.text: Moving through the lagoon.

dialogues.speaker: SUB
dialogues.text: Looking around uneasily as she drives the sub.

dialogues.speaker: THE LAGOON
dialogues.text: O.S., we hear the SOUND OF THE SUB.  No sign of the shark.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Trapped in the cave.  He hears the O.S. SOUND of the sub and looks out, trying to see.

dialogues.speaker: THE SUB
dialogues.text: Emerging from the water, coming straight at CAMERA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Camera draws around to show the cave ahead.  She looks around again for the shark.

dialogues.speaker: THE SUB
dialogues.text: Coming up to the cave.  Kathryn starts to push the sub front against the fallen concrete.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Pushing to one side to avoid the concrete piece the sub is pushing in.

dialogues.speaker: THE SUB
dialogues.text: Pushing at the concrete piece.

dialogues.speaker: KATHRYN
dialogues.text: Inside the sub, concentrating on the cave.  Suddenly, a dark form flashes into FRAME just overhead, making her jump in shock.  Then she sees --

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY AND DAISY
dialogues.text: Swimming around the sub.

dialogues.speaker: KATHRYN
dialogues.text: Returns to the concrete piece.

dialogues.speaker: THE SUB
dialogues.text: Pushing in the concrete piece.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Pressed against the cave wall, is almost touched by the concrete piece.  Now there is room enough for him to get out.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Starts to push out through the cave opening.  CAMERA ZOOMS IN on his face as he sees --

dialogues.speaker: THE SHARK
dialogues.text: In the distance, approaching again.

dialogues.speaker: KATHRYN AND DOLPHINS
dialogues.text: She reacts, seeing the dolphins dart out of FRAME. She looks after them.

dialogues.speaker: THE DOLPHINS
dialogues.text: Speeding toward the shark to intercept it.

dialogues.speaker: KATHRYN
dialogues.text: Her face reflecting her fear for the dolphins as she opens the canopy for Mike to get in.  He closes the canopy, both looking apprehensively toward the shark.

dialogues.speaker: WHAT THEY SEE
dialogues.text: Being butted by the two dolphins, deflecting its charge.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE AND KATHRYN
dialogues.text: Kathryn starting to drive the sub away.

dialogues.speaker: SUB
dialogues.text: As it starts away from the Fun Tunnel area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kathryn looking back toward the shark.

dialogues.speaker: THE DOLPHINS
dialogues.text: Still attacking the shark with some diversionary success.

dialogues.speaker: SUB
dialogues.text: Starting to rise as it passes over the Spanish Galleon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the b.g., the shark suddenly comes toward them at high speed, its massive size blotting out everything in b.g.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the giant shark hits the sub broadside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turning over in a complete circle, then righting itself, Kathryn trying to keep it moving forward.

dialogues.speaker: THE SHARK
dialogues.text: Attacking the submarine again, flinging it around like a cork, the attack by the dolphins only diverting it slightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shark seen outside, trying to close its jaws around the sub.

dialogues.speaker: THE SHARK
dialogues.text: Grabs the sub from behind and starts to shake it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shark seen in b.g., its enormous jaws closed around the back part of the submarine.  Kathryn reaches for something.

dialogues.speaker: CONTROL
dialogues.text: As Kathryn's hand in the violently shaking sub manages to increase the revolution of the propellers.

dialogues.speaker: THE PROPELLERS
dialogues.text: Spin faster, cutting the shark's maw.  Bleeding, it backs off, wheeling away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tries to drive it away, but the propellers will not turn now, they are jammed.  The sub starts sinking toward the bottom.  They both twist around.

dialogues.speaker: THE SHARK
dialogues.text: Moving away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Points toward the galleon.  Mike hesitates, then sees that they have no other chance and they slide back the canopy quickly, push out of the sinking sub, and swim toward the galleon.  The dolphins suddenly appear in FRAME, and Mike and Kathryn grab their fins, looking around to see where the shark is, reacting as they see

dialogues.speaker: THE SHARK
dialogues.text: Rushing back toward them.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE, KATHRYN, AND DOLPHINS
dialogues.text: The dolphins speed them to the opening of the galleon hold where they let go of the fins and kick down fast into the hold as the dolphins wheel around to attack the shark again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike and Kathryn swimming downward toward CAMERA. They kick into the dark hold, CAMERA pulling down from them, stopping.  They swim past CAMERA and, in the next moment, the berserk shark appears, trying to follow them into the hold.  It can't get through, the opening too small, but shatters part of the framing.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE AND KATHRYN
dialogues.text: Ducking away from and pushing aside large, falling pieces of lumber.  They look up, reacting as they see

dialogues.speaker: THE SHARK
dialogues.text: Lunging down into the opening again, breaking off more of the hold framing.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE AND KATHRYN
dialogues.text: Evading more falling wood, backing away as they look up at

dialogues.speaker: THE SHARK
dialogues.text: Trying once more, getting stuck in the hold opening which is now enlarged enough for it to wedge in part of its enormous form.

dialogues.speaker: THE SHARK
dialogues.text: Trying to get into the hold all the way, the two dolphins butting its side.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE AND KATHRYN
dialogues.text: Mike looks around, sees something and, grabbing Kathryn's arm, pulls her further into the body of the sunken hull, CAMERA PANNING         to show them moving toward the hol the ship's side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Mike and Kathryn push out through the opening and kick up with extreme caution.

dialogues.speaker: DECK EDGE
dialogues.text: As Mike and Kathryn appear, looking warily toward

dialogues.speaker: THE SHARK
dialogues.text: Still in the opening to the hold, trying to break through, the dolphins still butting its sides.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE AND KATHRYN
dialogues.text: Look at each other, then, abruptly, decide and kick upward, CAMERA with them.  As they move toward the surface, they look down at

dialogues.speaker: THE SHARK
dialogues.text: Starting to back out of the opening it has battered into the hold entrance.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE AND KATHRYN
dialogues.text: Kicking upward as fast as they can go.

dialogues.speaker: SURFACE
dialogues.text: As they break through, looking down.

dialogues.speaker: WHAT THEY SEE
dialogues.text: Coming up at them.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE AND KATHRYN
dialogues.text: Not knowing what to do.  They start spasmodically as the two dolphins rush up from beneath the water and appear nearby.  Without a word, Mike and Kathryn grab the dolphins' dorsal fins, and the dolphins start to rush them away.

dialogues.speaker: THE CHASE
dialogues.text: Shots alternating between Mike and Kathryn being pulled along by the dolphins and the giant shark pursuing them, getting closer and closer.  When it becomes apparent that the shark is going to overtake them, the dolphins make a sharp turn and elude its heavier, straight-forward impetu Seeing where they are, Mike points downward.  Kathryn hit Bobby on the side and he dives abruptly.  Daisy follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dolphins diving with Mike and Kathryn as they put their mouthpieces back in.  We see that they are outside the Control Room, the men inside looking out at them in shock.  Mike lets go of the fin and swims to the lock, gesturing for Kathryn to do the same.  She does and both take refuge in the concrete recess as the shark zooms into FRAME from behind CAMERA, rushing at them.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE RECESS
dialogues.text: As the huge shark comes at them.  Mike activates the outer door of the lock, and they are washed in just as the shark smashes its head against the concrete, jaws missing their feet by inches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shark still trying to get at them.  Mike shuts the outer door and starts to drain the water from the lock. As it comes below their heads, they pull out their mouthpieces and look at each other with dazed relief. He puts his arms around her, and they lean their fore- heads together, breathing hard.  The water is out of the lock in seconds;  inside, men activate the inner door

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Mike and Kathryn are helped in by the technicians. One of them looks toward the o.s. window suddenly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, my God! They whirl and look.

dialogues.speaker: THE SHARK
dialogues.text: Coming straight at the window as fast as it can.  With a deafening CRASH, it hits the window and the glass is shattered, a wall of water roaring in.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE AND KATHRYN AND THE MEN
dialogues.text: Swept across the Control Room by the giant wave of water flung around.  One man is smashed against a wall and killed.  Several others make it to the door, getting out just before the water slams it shut.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE AND KATHRYN
dialogues.text: Putting their mouthpieces in again as the Control Room fills with water.  They look toward

dialogues.speaker: THE SHARK
dialogues.text: With one of the technicians in its JAWS and is sub- dividing him.

dialogues.speaker: CONTROL ROOM
dialogues.text: Starts flooding.  A tape bank topples , crushing female technician.

dialogues.speaker: IMPALED SHARK
dialogues.text: Thrashes violently, working its way in.  It's caught on a huge section of thick glass piercing its side.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE AND KATHRYN
dialogues.text: Staring at the shark.  Suddenly, the air in Mike's tank runs out and, reacting, he taps Kathryn's arm.  She sees his problem, takes a deep breath, and gives him her mouthpiece.  They look toward the window at a loud SOUND.

dialogues.speaker: THE SHARK
dialogues.text: Still very much alive, throwing its gigantic weight forward, getting closer and closer to CAMERA, each violent lurch cutting its side open more, blood pouring from the jagged rent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As it gets closer and closer to them.  They back away, are blocked by a console.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Showing the shark closer yet.  Despite the impaling blade of glass, despite the internal injuries, the shark -- in seconds -- will have them.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE AND KATHRYN
dialogues.text: Sharing the mouthpiece, huddled together, helpless now. Then Kathryn's eyes widen, both react.

dialogues.speaker: THE SHARK
dialogues.text: Shaking its head as it inches forward, jaws open wide.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE AND KATHRYN
dialogues.text: Drawing back.  Kathryn SCREAMS.

dialogues.speaker: THE SHARK
dialogues.text: Emerging from its maw is Philip's body.

dialogues.speaker: PHILIP'S BODY
dialogues.text: We see the GRENADE locked in his fist.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Quickly grasps a metal strip from the tape bank and fashions a crude hook.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Times his move perfectly and KNOCKS the grenade out of Philip's locked fist.  The grenade comes to rest between the shark's TEETH.  Kathryn gives Mike some air, then

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Leaps forward and SNATCHES the grenade out of the shark's mouth.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Hurriedly wraps a metal strip around the grenade.

dialogues.speaker: KATHRYN
dialogues.text: Acts as a decoy and lures the shark's attention as

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: PULLS the grenade pin and

dialogues.speaker: SHOVES GRENADE
dialogues.text: Into the distracted shark's mouth.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE GRABS KATHRYN
dialogues.text: And they roll behind a Control Room desk and computer terminal console.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the shark is BLOWN OUT backward through the window opening, torn in half by the explosion, its massive remains starting to slide toward the lagoon bottom, turning the water crimson.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE AND KATHRYN
dialogues.text: Grabbing the stunned Kathryn, Mike pulls her to the window and out, starting upward through the bloody water.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE AND KATHRYN
dialogues.text: Sharing the air, they slowly float to the surface, buddy-buddy breathing.

dialogues.speaker: SURFACE
dialogues.text: Mike and Kathryn break through.  Helping each other, they make their way over to a camera pylon.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE AND KATHRYN
dialogues.text: Cling to the pylon and each other.

dialogues.speaker: KATHRYN
dialogues.text: Suddenly looks alarmed as she remembers:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby and Daisy. Mike looks about, no sign of the dolphins.

dialogues.speaker: KATHRYN
dialogues.text: Slaps the water hard three times. No dolphins. She does it again. And again.

dialogues.speaker: KATHRYN
dialogues.text: And now, in total ANGER AND FRUSTRATION, she pounds the water like Rocky on the punching bag until she is drained, and Kathryn breaks down sobbing as Mike holds her, trying to comfort her.

dialogues.speaker: DOLPHINS
dialogues.text: Come shooting to the surface!   They're banged and bruised, but are chirping excitedly and as HAPPY to see Kathryn and Mike as they are to see them.

dialogues.speaker: DOLPHINS
dialogues.text: Slowly swim around the hugging Mike and Kathryn as CAMERA PULLS UP to show the Sea Kingdom, in all its entirety, safe at last.
